column2: For as long as we have ruled here in [Root.Capital.GetName], we have entrusted the raising of our children to local nursemaids. We got used to their customs and dialect whitout forgetting our origin. So we learned both the way of the Northmen but also the way of our Andal ancestors.
It seems that this new [new_culture.Culture.GetName] language has now spread into [Root.GetName], a new culture born from a mix of the old.

Although many dislike change, this new [Root.Culture.GetName] language does have a certain functionality that cannot be denied. I have therefore prevailed upon a member of my court to adopt this for everyday administrative use.

For as long as we have ruled here in [Root.Capital.GetName], we have entrusted the raising of our children to local nursemaids. We got used to their customs and dialect whitout forgetting our origin. So we learned both the way of the Westermen but also the way of our Andal ancestors.

For as long as we have ruled here in [Root.Capital.GetName], we have entrusted the raising of our children to local nursemaids. We got used to their customs and dialect whitout forgetting our origin. So we learned both the way of the Reachmen but also the way of our Andal ancestors.
